should we don't have any entries inside that root table at the moment so if a packet did come in from one of those V pcs perhaps from the the 10.1 V PC and

if you have traffic destined to a particular IP address but you actually don't want it to flow for a particular reason you can actually just put a black
hole entry straight into the route table and that packet will get dropped it's important to remember when you have
static entries and black hole entries in your route table that they take precedence over anything that is coming
in dynamically ie anything that's coming fire that propagation process I talked about so effectively the static and the
